H0.text: Absorbed from the soil through the roots is how plants get water and minerals.

H1.text: Absorption from the soil through the stem allows plants to obtain water and minerals.

H2.text: Water and minerals are absorbed from the air through the flowers.

H3.text: Absorbed from the air through the leaves is how plants get water and minerals.

A4.text: Root epidermal cells and root hairs take up soil water and dissolved ions; these are then conducted to the shoot via the xylem.

A5.text: In vascular plants, the roots are the organs of a plant that are modified to provide anchorage for the plant and take in water and nutrients into the plant body, which allows plants to grow taller and faster.
